thread.title: John Lewis on AHCA: ‘I Oppose This Bill With Every Breath and Every Bone in My Body’
thread.title_full: John Lewis on AHCA: ‘I Oppose This Bill With Every Breath and Every Bone in My Body’

author: Justin Baragona
title: John Lewis on AHCA: ‘I Oppose This Bill With Every Breath and Every Bone in My Body’
text:
Video John Lewis on AHCA: ‘I Oppose This Bill With Every Breath and Every Bone in My Body’ by Justin Baragona | 2:52   Watch this 
John Lewis is shouting on the House floor: I'll “fight every day…I oppose this bill with every breath and every bone in my body” pic.twitter.com/RMwKs5JbJ7 
— Bradd Jaffy (@BraddJaffy) March 24, 2017 
Approaching a scheduled House vote on the American Health Care Act this afternoon, following yesterday’s postponement of the vote and President Donald Trump stating that he was done negotiating and wanted a vote today, a number of representatives took to the House floor to speak out on the bill. 
One of those House members to deliver a floor speech was Rep. John Lewis (D-GA), who expressed his fervent opposition to the AHCA in extremely impassioned remarks. 
“We cannot abandon our principles,” the civil rights icon bellowed. “Mr. Speaker, we cannot forget our values. I’ve fought too hard and too long to back down now. I will fight any bill that turns the clock back to a darker time.” 
He added, “Mr. Speaker, I will fight every day, every hour, every minute, and every second! I oppose this bill with every breath and every bone in my body!” 
Heading into today’s vote, NBC News claimed that there were 34 GOP House members who had stated they would vote no on the bill. Also, it was reported that Speaker of the House Paul Ryan told the president today he doesn’t have the votes to get the bill passed. 
Watch the clip above, via MSNBC. 
[image via screengrab]
